pullRequest.body:
and other simple pointwise lemmas for `Set` and `Finset`. Also add supporting `Fintype.piFinset` lemmas and fix the names of two lemmas.

From LeanAPAP and LeanCamCombi

What do you think about this?
```suggestion
instance instDecidableEq [DecidableEq Î±] : DecidableEq Î±áµáµáµ := unop_injective.decidableEq
```
Sure yeah! It should give the same algorithm in the end, so it's okay.
Should it be an `iff` lemma? May be, even `simp`?
For some reason I convinced myself the converse didn't hold. Fixed
Why do you move this section? Did you change any lemma, or just moved?
Moved and tagged `zero_smul_subset` simp. I need it to fire in my new proofs.
`zero_smul_subset` is not `simp`. Which lemma do you mean? `zero_smul_finset`?
Whoops yes sorry
Please add one of the `â` version without `Nonempty` assumption, see `Set.eval_image_pi_subset`.
Did you verify with `to_additive?` that it doesn't change `sâ»Â¹` to `-s` here?
It does, which is why I have extra lemmas below.
I don't remember whether we have fixed the coding style about `$` vs `<|`. Do you?
People sometimes say to use `<|` but it's not very applied, mostly because `|>` is weird and `$` is shorter and less ASCII art.
